intro: Smilacina flexuosa var. erubescens, commonly known as red-veined smilacina, is a flowering plant in the Araceae family. It is native to the eastern United States, where it thrives in moist, shaded woodlands. The plant produces striking, arrow-shaped leaves with reddish veins, and its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a colorful spathe. It has a climbing habit, often using tendrils to support itself on trees or shrubs. The botanical features of this variety make it a notable ornamental and ecological plant in its native habitat.
